questions: Give two examples of fossil fuels.
answers: Coal, Petroleum.

questions: What do you mean by fuel ?
answers: A substance that can be consumed to produce energy is called a fuel E.g., coal, petroleum.

questions: Write two characteristics of good fuel.
answers: Two characteristics of good fuel are : (i) It is smokeless and leaves no residue (ii) It has higher heat of combustion.

questions: Write the full form of CNG.
answers: Compressed natural gas.

questions: List two characteristics of a good source of energy.
answers: (i) Easily accessible and easy to store. (ii) Economical and eco-friendly.

questions: What are the two disadvantages of burning fossil fuels ?
answers: Disadvantages are air pollution and acid rain which affects soil and water.

questions: Mention any two limitations of using fossil fuels.
answers: (i) Fossil fuels will not last longer. (ii) They are non-renewable sources of energy. ½ + ½

questions: What are the materials obtained from plants and animals, and used as fuels called ? Name any two biomass energy source.
answers: The materials obtained from plants and animals, used as fuels are called biomass. Coal, wood etc. are the sources of biomass energy. ()

questions: How charcoal is different from wood ?
answers: When the same amount of charcoal and wood are burnt, charcoal produces almost twice the heat produced by wood. Charcoal produces much less smoke than wood.

questions: What is nuclear energy ?
answers: The energy released during nuclear fission or fusion, especially when used to generate electricity is called nuclear energy.

questions: Name one fuel used in nuclear reactor.
answers: Uranium–235.

questions: Name the reaction responsible for the large energy production in the sun. [Board Term I, Set (42), 2012]
answers: Nuclear fusion

questions: Write two disadvantages of Nuclear Energy.
answers: (i) Used for production and proliferation of nuclear weapons. (ii) Its generation is very expensive.

questions: Name the two major components present in the left-over slurry of a biogas plant.
answers: Nitrogen and phosphorus.

questions: Name an efficient fuel obtained from cowdung and other animal and plant wastes. Also mention its main constituents.
answers: Biogas, methane.

questions: Write the sequence of events taking place in a biogas plant.
answers: Slurry fed into digester → decomposition of biomass → production of gases to be used as a fuel.

questions: Name two combustible components of biogas.
answers: Methane and hydrogen are two combustible components of biogas.

questions: What are hot spots inside earth’s crust ?
answers: Hot spots are placed within the mantle where rocks melt to generate magma.

questions: Describe the areas where acid rains are most likely expected.
answers: Acid rains are most likely expected in industrial areas where there is emission of oxides of nitrogen and sulphur.

questions: Biogas is also known as gobar gas. Justify.
answers: Biogas is made up of waste products mainly gobar (cowdung). So it is known as gobar gas.
